Package com.l2h1.tamagotchi.model

Class House

java.lang.Object
com.l2h1.tamagotchi.model.House
All Implemented Interfaces:
JSONable
public class House extends Object implements JSONable
The House class represents both the habitat of a living entity (LivingEntity, called resident in this context) and its simulation.

There are 2 types of simulation: active and passive.

  • Passive simulation causes an entity to pass through time in one go, from point A in time to point B in time (see simulateWithTimestamps(long, long))
  • Active simulation, on the other hand, passes time to the entity continuously, updating its states every 15s (see scheduleSimulation())
It's important to note how the active simulation works: in fact, active simulation is run in a separate thread from a thread pool given by the ScheduledExecutorService, called the scheduler.

Therefore, 2 points need to be taken into account:

  • running a UI task that depends on active simulation must be done on the UI thread only (see Activity.runOnUiThread(Runnable))
  • stop simulation when it is no longer in use, to avoid memory leaks and unnecessary use of simulation thread resources

  • Method Details

    • startSimulation

      public void startSimulation()
      Starts the house active simulation. Checks the entity states before schedule the simulation.

      Calling this method has no effect if the scheduler is null.

      See Also:
      • scheduleSimulation()

    • scheduleSimulation

      private void scheduleSimulation()
      Schedule a periodic execution of the simulation command. The start delay is 15s. After this delay, the simulation is updated every 15s as follows:
      • check if the resident is alive; if not, call stopSimulation()
      • calls OnTimePassedListener.onTimePassed(LivingEntity) if the OnTimePassedListener is not null
      • simulate the time spent on the resident by calling LivingEntity.checkStates()
      This method should only be called if it has been verified that the scheduler is not null.

    • stopSimulation

      public void stopSimulation()
      Shutdowns the scheduler. This actions has no effect if the scheduler is null.
      See Also:
      • ExecutorService.shutdownNow()

    • setOnTimePassedListener

      public void setOnTimePassedListener(OnTimePassedListener listener)
      Register a callback to be invoked when the time passed in the active simulation.
      Parameters:
      listener - the new OnTimePassedListener for this house

    • simulateWithTimestamps

      public void simulateWithTimestamps(long start, long end)
      Performs passive simulation for the resident for a given time elapsed (calculated from the two arguments).
      Parameters:
      start - the timestamp for the start of passive simulation
      end - the timestamp for the end of passive simulation
